instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-B keyboard start problem
threads.message:
Hello

I'm working on 820-3437-B board was liquid damaged around trackpad (board is looking totally clean) Computer can not starting from keyboard but if battery not connected when plug magsafe adapter starts(its normal i know)  and works normally . When touch power button ( not long press only one sec is) computer stop working and totally dead ( not magsafe led or any sign of working).

Tried knows good keyboard, trackpad, trackpad flex,battery and I/O board nothing changed.

SMC_ONOFF_L is 3.3V and when battery connected short it to ground doesn't start computer ( normally must be start) also replaced SMC nothing change...

Note: When start computer plug magsafe cable without battery; if you press power button computer stops 1 second and start again him self.

Any idea for check next step

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-B keyboard start problem
threads.message: SMC_LSOC_RST_L is being pulled down. So corrosion around U5110 or trackpad connector. If that is clean it MUST be the trackpad or flat cable or both.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437-B keyboard start problem
threads.message: Thank you very much Duke. After replace track pad connector from board side problem solved.
